sentence.text: Exemestane is extensively metabolized by CYP 3A4, but coadministration of ketoconazole, a potent inhibitor of CYP 3A4, has no significant effect on exemestane pharmacokinetics.
sentence.negationtags: Exemestane is extensively metabolized by CYP 3A4, but coadministration of ketoconazole, a potent inhibitor of CYP 3A4, has <scope> <cue> no significant </cue> effect on exemestane pharmacokinetics. </scope>

sentence.text: Significant pharmacokinetic interactions mediated by inhibition of CYP isoenzymes therefore appear unlikely.
sentence.negationtags: <scope> Significant pharmacokinetic interactions mediated by inhibition of CYP isoenzymes therefore appear <cue> unlikely. </cue> </scope>

sentence.text: Co-medications that induce CYP 3A4 (e.g., rifampicin, phenytoin, carbamazepine, phenobarbital, or St. John s wort) may significantly decrease exposure to exemestane.
Dose modification is recommended for patients who are also receiving a potent CYP 3A4 inducer.
Drug/Laboratory Tests Interactions No clinically relevant changes in the results of clinical laboratory tests have been observed.
sentence.negationtags: Drug/Laboratory Tests Interactions <scope> <cue> No </cue> clinically relevant changes in the results of clinical laboratory tests have been observed. </scope>
